Title: LinkedIn founder sees gold in connections

Author: edw519
Content: This is a quick fix to address short term profitability and stock price.  If I were a stockholder, I'd be asking the bigger questions like what markets will yahoo be in in 5 years.  The battle lines are being drawn now.  What will differentiate yahoo from the googles, microsofts, amazons, and ebays of the world?  I wish I knew.

Author: mechanical_fish
Content:
Yes, it's true: You will probably never have to worry about whether or not DTrace is compatible with the Linux version of iTunes. That is one problem you will never have.

You may also never have to use DTrace with the Linux versions of 1Password, Adium, Audio Hijack, Automator, Colloquy, GarageBand, Handbrake, Path Finder, Pixelmator, Quicksilver, NetNewsWire, Snapz Pro, Textmate, Transmit, Twitterific, VisualHub, or xScope. To say nothing of Photoshop or Logic Pro. Just think of all the bugs you will never have to find.

Of course, based on a quick Google search for "dtrace Linux", you don't seem to be able to run DTrace on Linux at all. But, if you could, I'm sure it would be perfect!

Mind you, I love Linux and I use it all the time. Just not on my desktop.

Author: gms
Content: You're talking about young 20-somethings. But consider older people with children. These Gulf countries are (and have always been, but moreso now) willing to pay a lot of money (tax free) along with a boatload of benefits to experienced westerners who would work with them. It's hard to turn that down when you have children who one day will go to private American universities, etc.

Author: justin
Content:
Thanks for pointing that out, Emmett, we are indeed hiring! Both our chat server and Video cluster are written in Python's Twisted framework. We're always looking for smart hackers who want to help us make our systems better. Everyone at JTV is tossed in the deep end (Bill, who found us through news.yc, learned Twisted, wrote and deployed our chat server in his first two weeks here). Find out more here: http://blog.justin.tv/2007/07/justintv-is-hiring.html

Or email justin at justin.tv
